entries.text: Optimizes fire control of AC and weapons to enhance all sources of kinetic damage, excluding melee weapons.
Optimizes power output of AC and weapons to enhance all sources of energy damage, excluding melee weapons.
Optimizes fuse control of AC and weapons to enhance all sources of explosive damage, excluding melee weapons.
Optimizes drive control of AC and weapons to enhance all sources of melee damage.
Improves the precision of attacks against staggered enemies, increasing damage dealt by direct hits.
Improves the precision of ACS-based bracing posture control, reducing damage received from enemy attacks.
Improves the AC's ability to scan for damage, boosting the effectiveness of Repair Kits.
Improves object access speed by optimizing hacking and override functionality.

Unlocks the ability to sortie when AC is overburdened, and to manually purge weapons. Purging weapons reduces weight load and improves speed.
<?kgicon@26?> + <?kgicon@18?> / <?kgicon@17?> / <?kgicon@20?> / <?kgicon@19?>: Manual Purge

Unlocks the ability to perform a Boost Kick. Boost Kicks hit with heavy impact by combining the speed of an Assault Boost with the sheer weight of the AC.
<?kgicon@9?> during Assault Boost: Boost Kick

Unlocks the Weapon Bay feature for AC shoulders, allowing shoulder weapons to be replaced with additional hand weapons.
With hand weapon equipped to corresponding shoulder: <?kgicon@20?>: Switch Right Hand Weapon <?kgicon@19?>: Switch Left Hand Weapon

Unlocks the ability to perform manual aiming. Allows for manual reticle control, but practical usage calls for experienced technique.
Hold <?kgicon@15?>: Enable Manual Aiming <?kgicon@15?> with Manual Aiming ON: Disable Manual Aiming

Unlocks the Quick Turn feature, allowing the AC to perform snap turns to side or rear directions.
<?kgicon@6?> + <?kgicon@90?>: Quick Turn

Unlocks Core Expansion: Assault Armor and allows it to be installed. Assault Armor creates a pulse explosion centered on the AC, canceling out incoming enemy fire and creating a damaging area-of-effect shockwave.
<?kgicon@99?> while equipped: Activate Assault Armor

Unlocks Core Expansion: Pulse Armor and allows it to be installed. Pulse Armor creates a pulse barrier that trails the AC, dramatically increasing defensive performance until it exceeds its durability or time limit.
<?kgicon@99?> while equipped: Activate Pulse Armor

Unlocks Core Expansion: Pulse Protection and allows it to be installed. Pulse Protection creates a pulse barrier in a fixed position, providing cover from enemy fire until the barrier reaches its durability or time limit.
<?kgicon@99?> while equipped: Activate Pulse Protection

Unlocks Core Expansion: Terminal Armor and allows it to be installed. Terminal Armor automatically triggers a pulse barrier when the AC's AP reaches its limit, greatly enhancing defense until the barrier reaches its durability or time limit.
When equipped, activates automatically when AP falls to 0.
Buy and sell parts for AC assembly.
Sortie on missions, or hone your skills using mercenary support simulators.
Apply OS upgrades to your AC.
Change AC parts and adjust its appearance.
Manage AC assemblies, appearance settings, and other AC data.
Enter the "Arena" combat aptitude evaluation program.
Check received requests and sortie on missions.
Sortie on missions that you have already completed.
Learn AC controls and basic tactics via mercenary support simulators.
Create images for use as decals or pilot emblems.
Quit mission and return to the Garage.
Restart mission from the most recent checkpoint.
Configure settings for enemies appearing in this test.
End program and return to the Garage.
Quit training and return to the Garage.
Quit test and return to the Garage.
End the match and return to the Versus Room.
Restart mission from the most recent checkpoint.
Quit mission and return to the Garage.

Set the maximum number of Versus Room participants.
Options vary depending on match format.

Select from one of two match formats.
Single: 1-vs-1. The first player to secure a two-phase lead wins.
• Win phase or draw to earn 1 point. First player to score 2 pts. wins.
Team: 3-vs-3. Two teams compete in an endurance match.
• Destroy enemy ACs to score team points. The highest-scoring team when time is called wins.
• The player with the most kills will be marked as a priority target. Destroy them to earn extra points.
Set the time limit for the match.
Select the map used for the match.

Select one of three member rotation methods.
Hosts can manually designate room members to sortie/spectate regardless of the rotation method chosen.
Locked No automatic rotation. Members are locked in for subsequent sorties.
Losers Rotate Losers of previous match spectate, changing places with reserves who did not sortie.
Winners Rotate Winners of previous match spectate, changing places with reserves who did not sortie.

Select an option to configure room access.
Open: Players can join via room search.
Private: Room will not appear in room search.

Select keywords for the Versus Room.
Room searches using matching keywords will show this room in their results.
Create Versus Room with configured settings.
Create Versus Room with configured settings.
Create Versus Room with configured settings.
Scan vicinity around AC to detect enemies and part containers.
Toggles Target Assist on or off.
Attempts computer access to a nearby object.
Used in combination with other controls to perform special actions.
Manually purges weapon when used in combination with <?kgicon@18?> / <?kgicon@17?> / <?kgicon@20?> / <?kgicon@19?>.
Selects option appearing on the left.
Selects option appearing on the right.
Choose whether Target Assist should remain enabled after destroying the current target.

Choose a method to activate Core Expansions.
TYPE A: Assault Boost + Shift
TYPE B: Assault Boost + Target Assist
Automatically purges weapon when that weapon's ammunition is fully depleted.

Configure y-axis camera controls.
Normal: Default up/down controls.
Inverted: Reversed up/down controls.

Configure x-axis camera controls.
Normal: Default left/right controls.
Inverted: Reversed left/right controls.

Select game display mode.
Windowed: Displays in a window.
Full Screen: Displays in full-screen mode.
Borderless Window: Simulates full-screen display.

Enable or disable HDR.
(Only applicable for HDR-compatible displays.)
Configure screen luminosity, brightness, and saturation when HDR is enabled.
Automatically adjusts rendering settings when frame rate decreases occur.
Configure advanced settings for rendering quality.

Enable or disable ray tracing.
(This setting only applies to the Garage.)
Choose whether to prioritize image quality or frame rate.
Enable/disable function to sync frame rate with refresh rate of the display.
Adjust brightness until the image on the left is barely visible.
Makes edges appear smoother when rendering the picture.
Configure the quality of shadows resulting from indirect lighting.
Configure the quality of depth-of-field rendering effects.
Configure the quality of motion blur effects.
Configure the quality of shadow rendering.
Configure the quality of light effects.
Configure the quality of various effects.
Configure the quality of volumetric fog.
Configure the quality of reflection effects.
Configure the quality of water surface rendering.

Configure ray tracing quality.
(This setting only applies to the Garage.)
Toggle display of subtitles on or off.
Choose a HUD display method. The Automatic setting hides the HUD when out of combat.
Choose the device that on-screen prompts should represent.

Configure mouse x-axis controls.
Normal: Default left/right controls.
Inverted: Reversed left/right controls.

Configure mouse y-axis controls.
Normal: Default up/down controls.
Inverted: Reversed up/down controls.

Choose which mode (online or offline) to start in from title launch.
Setting will be applied after returning to title screen.
Change the setting to consent to data usage.
Select region to use for matchmaking.
Change the language used for game text.

Change the language used for game voices.
Based on Region Setting: Sets the language to Japanese or English based on the region supported by the game.
